intro: Manisuris tuberculosa, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Manisuris tuberculosa is considered a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap.
